required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Efficacy and Safety of EUFLEXXA™ for Treatment of Painful Osteoarthritis of the Knee
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Study of the Efficacy and Safety of EUFLEXXA™ for Treatment of Painful Osteoarthritis of the Knee, With an Open-Label Safety Extension

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, double-blind study will be performed in approximately 600 subjects with chronic idiopathic osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee. An open-label safety extension will follow.

primary_outcome.measure: Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Double-blind Study
primary_outcome.description: The level of pain is estimated by the participant following a walk of 50 feet in length which is observed by the investigator. Pain estimates were evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Double-blind Study
primary_outcome.description: The percent difference in participant pain recorded by the participant during a walk of 50 feet in length between the baseline (week 0) and week 26 scores. Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters; a score of 0 millimeters meaning no pain was observed; a score of 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.

primary_outcome.measure: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Range of Motion Findings at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Range of motion indicates the flexibility of the knee, and is measured by the number of degrees between when the knee is hyper-extended and when the knee is flexed.

primary_outcome.measure: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Tenderness at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Tenderness of the knee was subjectively rated by participants as none, mild, moderate or severe.

primary_outcome.measure: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Local Warmth at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Local warmth of the target knee was recorded as Yes (warmth present) or No (knee was not warmer than expected).

primary_outcome.measure: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Redness at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Redness of the knee was subjectively rated as Yes (knee was red) and No (knee was not red).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Screening in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Double-blind Study
secondary_outcome.description: The percent difference in participant pain recorded by the participant during a walk of 50 feet in length between the screening (week -1) and week 26 scores. Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters; a score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Double-blind Study for a Subpopulation of Participants With More Severe Knee Pain
secondary_outcome.description: Percent difference in participant pain during a walk of 50 feet in length between the mean screening (week -1) and baseline(week 0) scores, and week 26 scores. Scores are recorded by participants and measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters, with 0 millimeters meaning there was no pain observed; 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the 50-Foot Walk Test at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: 50-foot walk test for pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer: YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the 50-Foot Walk Test at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: 50-foot walk test for pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer: YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the Western Ontario McMaster University Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC A) Pain Scale at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: WOMAC (A) pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer: YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the Western Ontario McMaster University Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC A) Pain Scale at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: WOMAC (A) pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer: YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient Global Assessment of Knee Pain at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Participant assessment of knee pain evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Number of Tablets of Rescue Medication Used at Week 26.
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the number of tablets of 500 milligram acetaminophen used in a week as rescue medication is compared at weeks 0 and weeks 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) Physical Function (PF) Score at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' physical function. The questionnaire is completed by participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) Bodily Pain(BP) Score at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' bodily pain scores. The questionnaire is completed by participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) General Health(GH) Score at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' general health scores. The questionnaire is completed by participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. The questionnaire is completed by participants. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With 20 Millimeter or Greater Improvement in Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test
secondary_outcome.description: Yes represents the number of participants whose pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was improved at week 26 over baseline by at least 20 millimeters. Pain was evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale by participants. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participant pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was evaluated by participants on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: The mean difference in participant pain as measured by participants during a walk of 50 feet in length between the baseline (week 26 pre-dose) and week 52 scores. Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters, with a score of 0 millimeters meaning there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the 50-Foot Walk Test at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: 50-foot walk test for pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer:YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Extension Study Week 26) in Use of Rescue Medication at Week 52.
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the number of tablets of study-specific acetaminophen taken per week as a rescue medication from knee pain.

arm_group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.
Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

All patients who participated in the 26 week double-blind study (including participants randomized to the placebo treatment group) and elected to participate in the open label extension, received three injections of EUFLEXXA™ in the target knee. Injections were given once a week on weeks 26, 27 and 28.

intervention.description: EUFLEXXA™ is supplied in a single-dose syringe containing 20 mg/2 ml of 1% sodium hyaluronate (molecular weight 2.4-3.6 MD); sodium chloride, 17 mg; disodium hydrogen phosphate dodecahydrate, 1.12 mg; sodium dihydrogen phosphate dihydrate, 0.1 mg; enough water for injection to make 2.0 ml. EUFLEXXA™ is supplied in 2.25 ml nominal volume, disposable prefilled glass syringes containing 2 mL of EUFLEXXA™. Only the contents of the syringe are sterile. EUFLEXXA™ is nonpyrogenic. See package insert for further details.
Placebo is supplied in a disposable prefilled glass syringe. Each single-dose syringe will contain 2 mL of phosphate buffered saline. Only the contents of the syringe are sterile.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Chronic OA of target knee confirmed by ACR Criteria
2. Pain due to OA in target knee present for at least 6 months:
• Moderate to severe pain score of 41 mm to 90 mm recorded on a 100 mm VAS immediately following a 50-foot walk
3. A bilateral standing AP X-ray confirming OA of the target knee—obtained within a 6-month period prior to the Screening Visit—and a grade of 2 or 3 according to the Kellgren and Lawrence Grading Scale
4. Ability and willingness to use only acetaminophen as the analgesic (rescue) study medication
- The acetaminophen dose must not exceed 4 grams/day (4000 mg)
- If subject has known chronic liver disease, the maximum dose of acetaminophen must not exceed 2 grams/day (2000 mg)
- The subject must be willing and able to discontinue acetaminophen at least 24 hours prior to all study-specific visits
- The study specific acetaminophen provided will only be used for knee pain.
5. Ability to perform procedures required of the pain index evaluations (unassisted walking 50 feet on a flat surface and going up and down stairs).
6. Willingness and ability to complete efficacy and safety questionnaires and ability to read and understand study instructions
7. Signed study-specific Subject Informed Consent Form
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any major injury (including sports injuries) to the target knee within the 12 months prior to the Screening Visit
2. Any surgery to the target knee within the 12 months prior to the Screening Visit, or surgery to the contralateral knee or other weight-bearing joint if it will interfere with knee assessments
3. Prior articular procedures, such as transplants or ligament reconstruction to the target knee
4. Inflammatory arthropathies such as rheumatoid arthritis, lupus arthropathy, or psoriatic arthritis
5. Gout or calcium pyrophosphate (pseudogout) diseases that have flared within the previous 6 months prior to the Screening Visit
6. X-ray findings of acute fractures, severe loss of bone density, avascular necrosis, and/or severe bone or joint deformity in the target knee
7. Osteonecrosis of either knee
8. Fibromyalgia, pes anserine bursitis, lumbar radiculopathy, and/or neurogenic or vascular claudication
9. Significant anterior knee pain due to diagnosed isolated patella-femoral syndrome or chondromalacia in the target knee
10. Significant target knee joint infection or skin disorder/infection within the previous 6 months prior to study enrollment
11. Symptomatic OA of the hips, spine, or ankle, if it would interfere with the evaluation of the target knee
12. Known hypersensitivity to acetaminophen, EUFLEXXA™, or Phosphate buffered saline solution
13. Women of childbearing potential who are pregnant, nursing, or planning to become pregnant, and those who do not agree to remain on an acceptable method of birth control throughout the entire study period
14. Recurrent medical history of severe allergic or immune-mediated reactions or other immune disorders
15. Vascular insufficiency of lower limbs or peripheral neuropathy severe enough to interfere with the study evaluation
16. Current treatment or treatment within the previous 2 years prior to the Screening Visit for any malignancy unless specific written permission is provided by the Sponsor (excluding basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin)
17. Active liver disease based on liver profile of AST, ALT, and conjugated bilirubin >2 times the upper limit of normal
18. Renal insufficiency based on serum creatinine >2.0 mg/dL
19. Any clinically significant laboratory value based on clinical history that the Investigator feels may affect the study evaluation
20. Any intercurrent chronic disease or condition that may interfere with the completion of the 6-month (or 12-month) follow-up of the study, such as liver disease, severe coronary disease, drug abuse, disordered mental state, or other clinically significant condition
21. Current alcoholism, and/or any known current addiction to pain medications
22. Any clinically significant finding that would place the patient at health risk, impact the study, or affect the completion of the study
23. Any psychiatric illness that would prevent comprehension of the details and nature of the study
24. Participation in any experimental drug or device study within the 6 months prior to the Screening Visit

results_reference.citation: Altman RD, Rosen JE, Bloch DA, Hatoum HT. Safety and efficacy of retreatment with a bioengineered hyaluronate for painful osteoarthritis of the knee: results of the open-label Extension Study of the FLEXX Trial. Osteoarthritis Cartilage. 2011 Oct;19(10):1169-75. doi: 10.1016/j.joca.2011.07.001. Epub 2011 Jul 23.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 821 patients were screened.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

participants_list.participants: Data could not be retrieved for two participants
Data could not be retrieved for two participants

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index (BMI) is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to both adult men and women. Body mass index is calculated as weight / (height times height).

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: Mean body weight of study participants in kilograms

outcome.description: The level of pain is estimated by the participant following a walk of 50 feet in length which is observed by the investigator. Pain estimates were evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters; a score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

analysis.method_desc: Screening pain score was the covariate; study center was modeled as a random effect while all other variables were modeled as fixed effects.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Double-blind Study for a Subpopulation of Participants With More Severe Knee Pain
outcome.description: Percent difference in participant pain during a walk of 50 feet in length between the mean screening (week -1) and baseline(week 0) scores, and week 26 scores. Scores are recorded by participants and measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters, with 0 millimeters meaning there was no pain observed; 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. A subpopulation of patients with more severe knee pain, as measured by having a greater than or equal to 41 millimeter screening score on the 50-foot walk test.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

outcome.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Range of Motion Findings at Week 52
outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Range of motion indicates the flexibility of the knee, and is measured by the number of degrees between when the knee is hyper-extended and when the knee is flexed.
outcome.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Range of Motion Findings at Week 52
measure.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Range of motion indicates the flexibility of the knee, and is measured by the number of degrees between when the knee is hyper-extended and when the knee is flexed.
measure.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

outcome.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Tenderness at Week 52
outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Tenderness of the knee was subjectively rated by participants as none, mild, moderate or severe.
outcome.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Tenderness at Week 52
measure.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Tenderness of the knee was subjectively rated by participants as none, mild, moderate or severe.
measure.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

outcome.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Local Warmth at Week 52
outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Local warmth of the target knee was recorded as Yes (warmth present) or No (knee was not warmer than expected).
outcome.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Local Warmth at Week 52
measure.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Local warmth of the target knee was recorded as Yes (warmth present) or No (knee was not warmer than expected).
measure.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

outcome.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Redness at Week 52
outcome.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Redness of the knee was subjectively rated as Yes (knee was red) and No (knee was not red).
outcome.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Shifts From Extension Study Baseline (Week 26) in Ratings of Knee Redness at Week 52
measure.description: Number of participants in various categories of target knee joint examination findings from baseline (week 26 pre-injection) to week 52. Redness of the knee was subjectively rated as Yes (knee was red) and No (knee was not red).
measure.population: Safety population which includes all participants who received at least one injection during the extension phase of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Global Assessment of Knee Pain at Week 26
outcome.description: Participant assessment of knee pain evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Global Assessment of Knee Pain at Week 26
measure.description: Participant assessment of knee pain evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Number of Tablets of Rescue Medication Used at Week 26.
outcome.description: The change in the number of tablets of 500 milligram acetaminophen used in a week as rescue medication is compared at weeks 0 and weeks 26.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Number of Tablets of Rescue Medication Used at Week 26.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) Physical Function (PF) Score at Week 26
outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' physical function. The questionnaire is completed by participants.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

outcome.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. The questionnaire is completed by participants. group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-Blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Short Form 36 Questionnaire (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score at Week 26
measure.description: The SF-36 questionnaire yields a score for each domain of health. All domains are scored on a scale from 0 (negative health) to 100 (positive health), with 100 representing the best possible health state. The questionnaire is completed by participants. This table summarizes the change from baseline in participants' physical health.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With 20 Millimeter or Greater Improvement in Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test
outcome.description: Yes represents the number of participants whose pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was improved at week 26 over baseline by at least 20 millimeters. Pain was evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale by participants. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

measure.title: Number of Participants With 20 Millimeter or Greater Improvement in Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test
measure.description: Yes represents the number of participants whose pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was improved at week 26 over baseline by at least 20 millimeters. Pain was evaluated on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale by participants. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.

outcome.title: Observed Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
outcome.description: Participant pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was evaluated by participants on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. No imputation for missing values.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Observed Pain Scores on the 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
measure.description: Participant pain during a walk of 50 feet in length was evaluated by participants on a 100 millimeter visual analog scale. A score of 0 millimeters means there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters means extreme pain was observed.
measure.population: Intent to treat population. No imputation for missing values.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
outcome.description: The mean difference in participant pain as measured by participants during a walk of 50 feet in length between the baseline (week 26 pre-dose) and week 52 scores. Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters, with a score of 0 millimeters meaning there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. No imputation for missing values.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Observed Pain Scores on 50-foot Walk Test During the Extension Study
measure.description: The mean difference in participant pain as measured by participants during a walk of 50 feet in length between the baseline (week 26 pre-dose) and week 52 scores. Scores are measured on a visual analog scale of 100 millimeters, with a score of 0 millimeters meaning there was no pain observed; a score of 100 millimeters meaning extreme pain was observed.
measure.population: Intent to treat population. No imputation for missing values.

outcome.title: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the 50-Foot Walk Test at Week 52
outcome.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: 50-foot walk test for pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer:YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Number of Observed Osteoarthritis Research Society International (OARSI30) Responders Using the 50-Foot Walk Test at Week 52
measure.description: Responders are identified based on a calculation of three scales: 50-foot walk test for pain, function and global assessment scales. Each of the individual scales was completed by the participant. A participant was a responder (answer:YES) if there was high improvement in pain or function (>=50 percent and absolute change of >=20 millimeters), or improvement in at least two of three categories: Pain and/or Function and/or Patient Global Assessment scales of >=20 percent and absolute change >=10 millimeter.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Extension Study Week 26) in Use of Rescue Medication at Week 52.
outcome.description: The change in the number of tablets of study-specific acetaminophen taken per week as a rescue medication from knee pain.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

measure.title: Change From Baseline (Extension Study Week 26) in Use of Rescue Medication at Week 52.
measure.description: The change in the number of tablets of study-specific acetaminophen taken per week as a rescue medication from knee pain.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: Placebo Double-blind
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of placebo into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 0, 1 and 2. Patients were followed for 26 weeks following the first injection.

group.title: EUFLEXXA™ Extension Study
group.description: Each subject received 3 single-dose injections of EUFLEXXA™ (20 milligram/2 milliliter 1 percent sodium hyaluronate) into the target knee; one injection per week at weeks 26, 27 and 28. Patients were followed for 26 additional weeks (to week 52) following the first injection.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review the draft manuscript prior to publication and can request delay of publication where any contents are deemed patentable by the sponsor or confidential to the sponsor. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the draft manuscript.
